meanings.definition: Not able to be remedied or corrected.
meanings.sent1: The damage to the ancient artifact was irremediable.
meanings.sent2: The doctor sadly informed the patient that the illness was irremediable.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt to salvage the burnt dish was irremediable.
meanings.sent4: The crack in the foundation was an irremediable flaw in the building's design.
meanings.sent5: The irremediable mistake cost the team the championship.

meanings.sent1: The irremediable condition left the patient with no hope for recovery.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic declared the engine failure as irremediable.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to undo the trick was irremediable.
meanings.sent4: The irremediable leak in the roof caused constant water damage.
meanings.sent5: The irremediable error in the code crashed the entire system.
